instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Part Needed
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5060</TRANSISTOR> on this board is corroded and spoiled. Had to remove it.
Require a replacement but dont have a donor board.
Any part from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> can be installed here ? Please help

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Part Needed
threads.message: I don't remember to saw such "combo" in newer models...
